revised_title: Spectral Luminosity and Photometry: A Comparative Study of Dark Adaptation and Light Adaptation
tldr: This study investigates the luminosity of the spectrum using two methods: the minimal effective stimulus and flicker photometry. The results show that the green light is the most potent in the dark-adapted eye, while the yellow is the most potent in the light-adapted eye. The findings suggest that the eye's adaptation to light or dark conditions significantly impacts the perceived potency of different colors in the spectrum.
